title: What’s Happening in Space Policy May 25-31, 2025
summary: Here is SpacePolicyOnline.com’s list of space policy events for the week of May 25-31, 2025 and any insight we can offer about them. The House and Senate are in recess […]

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 23 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 launch from Cape Canaveral
summary: The Starlink 12-22 mission will be the 45 Starlink mission of the year. SpaceX is targeting a liftoff from pad 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station at 1:19 p.m. EDT (1719 UTC).

title: SpaceX blames Starship Flight 8 mishap on engine hardware failure
summary:
The failure of SpaceX’s Starship on its most recent test flight had a different root cause than the previous failure, despite happening at about the same time.
The post SpaceX blames Starship Flight 8 mishap on engine hardware failure appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Raytheon secures $380 million contract extension for GPS ground control system
summary:
The Next Generation Operational Control System (OCX) is a critical software upgrade for the Global Positioning System (GPS) infrastructure and is now more than eight years behind schedule.
The post Raytheon secures $380 million contract extension for GPS ground control system appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: FAA clears SpaceX to launch its 9th Starship super heavy rocket, while Flight 8 mishap investigation continues
summary: A series of aviation and marine warnings suggest the launch could be as soon as Tuesday, May 27, following the Memorial Day holiday. SpaceX has not publicly stated when it plans to launch the Starship Flight 9 mission.

title: NASA Awards Project Support Bridge Contract
summary: NASA has awarded a bridge contract to ASRC Federal System Solutions LLC of Beltsville, Maryland, to provide financial support and project planning and control services to the agency. The Program Analysis and Control Bridge Contract has a total potential value up to $98 million with a 13-month period of performance beginning Saturday, May 24. The […]

title: SpaceX Readies IFT-9 Starship Test Flight, Explains IFT-8 Failure
summary: SpaceX said today it plans to launch the ninth Starship Integrated Flight Test, IFT-9, on Tuesday, May 27.  The flight follows two successive failures of the Starship second stage. Both […]

title: Moon and Flag at NASA Michoud
summary: Just after sunrise, the waning gibbous moon sets just behind a waving United States flag on March 19, 2025, in this image from NASA’s Michoud Assembly Facility in New Orleans. The waning gibbous moon phase comes after the full moon. As the Moon begins its journey back toward the Sun, the opposite side of the […]
